February 27th, 2009, 8:32 am· ·posted by Nancy Luna, Staff Writer
Carl's Jr. Jumbo Chili Dog is selling in some SoCal restaurants. (2 for $3)
Thanks to a tip from Fast Food Maven reader, Eric , I’ve discovered that Carl’s Jr. has been selling chili dogs in a limited number of Southern California restaurants.
Eric told me he spotted the Jumbo Dogs at a Carl’s Jr. in Norco, Ca. Does this mean the famous chili dog is making a comeback? (Remember, Carl’s Jr. founder Carl Karcher got his start as a hot dog vendor.)
Carl’s Jr. spokeswoman Beth Mansfield confirmed some details about the so-called Return of the Carl’s Jr. Chili Dog:
“Two for $3 Jumbo Chili Dogs are currently being offered in some markets as an ongoing test. We’ve had a lot of positive customer feedback and will hopefully bring them back on a larger scale soon,”she said.
Carl’s Jr. restaurants in Brea, Yorba Linda, Fullerton and Placentia are the only ones in Orange County currently selling the dogs. ( CLICK HERE FOR a LIST of Carl’s Jr. chili dog locations )
Mansfield declined to comment more about the chili dog’s comeback.
I suspect, Newport Beach-based Wienerschnitzel knows more.
The nation’s largest hot dog chain will launch a new jumbo dog on Sunday dubbed the Big Original Chili Dog. The chain says the new dog is 84% larger than a regular Wienerschnitzel chili dog.
Guess how much it cost? You got it: 2 for $3!
The Big Original is 84% larger than a normal Wienerschnitzel chili dog. The cost: 2 for$3. (Additional cost for cheese and onions.)
Coincidence? Of course not.
Wienerschnitzel said it had planned to launch the new dog this spring. But, officials moved up the product’s debut“to counter Carl’s Jr.’s chili dog launch,”the chain said.
“Sources suggest that the new Carl’s Jr. dog will be microwaved,”an aghast Wienerschnitzel marketing rep told me via email.
Now, that is some serious wiener dog smack talk.
I don’t like to let these kind of accusations go without further investigation. So, I called a few Carl’s Jr. restaurants and employees told me their dog is, indeed, microwaved!
So be it.
Let the chili dog wars begin.
Tell us: If you spot a Carl’s Jr. restaurant selling chili dogs in the next few weeks, please list it here under comments. If you try the chili dogs from both chains, write in and give us your feedback.
